sources.title: The Lady Lies (1929) CLAUDETTE COLBERT üçï WALTER HUSTON
sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Starring Walter Huston, Claudette Colbert, Charles Ruggles
Directed by Hobart Henley

A widowed businessman falls in love with a stylish department store saleswoman, sparking conflict with his disapproving children. As generational tensions flare, this emotionally charged story explores themes of family loyalty, forbidden love, and changing social values in the wake of the Roaring Twenties.

Directed by Hobart Henley and featuring a powerful early performance from Walter Huston, this rare film marks the screen debut of Claudette Colbert, who would later become one of Hollywood‚Äôs most iconic leading ladies. Shot during the transitional period from silent films to talkies, it offers a rare glimpse into 1920s social norms, family dynamics, and romantic ideals just before the enforcement of the Production Code.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üçï Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every Friday on PizzaFLIX.

Perfect for fans of classic Hollywood, early talkies, and pre-Code films, this rare gem highlights the cultural clashes between tradition and modernity in a time of social upheaval. Don‚Äôt miss this beautifully preserved piece of cinematic history.

#TheLadyLies #WalterHuston #ClaudetteColbert #EarlyTalkies #1929Cinema #PreCodeHollywood #ParamountPictures #HobartHenley #ClassicMovies #OldHollywood #VintageFilm #TransitionToSound #FilmHistory #GoldenAgeCinema #PreCodeDrama

metadata.Plot: Much to the disapproval of his snooty children, a wealthy widowed attorney takes up with a beautiful but "lower-class" woman.
metadata.Writer: John Meehan, Garrett Fort, Mort Blumenstock
metadata.Actors: Walter Huston, Claudette Colbert, Charles Ruggles
